observation: I see a language selection dropdown is open with many language options. Since I'm an elderly user who prefers simple navigation and I notice the email input field is disabled, I should close this language selector first by selecting English to proceed with the signup process.
reasoning: As an elderly user, I need to focus on the main task of signing up. The language dropdown is open and blocking my view. I should select English (which appears to be already highlighted) to close this dropdown and return to the signup form.
ux_issues: Language dropdown opened unexpectedly and blocks main content
Email field is disabled which is confusing

outcome.visual_observation: The language selection action did not progress the sign-up flow. Both screenshots show the same registration form with email input field, social login options (Google, Facebook, Apple), and 'Create account' button. The only visible change is the removal of colored navigation elements on the right side of the screen.
outcome.diagnosis: The English language option tap appears to have only affected the UI language/localization but did not advance the user through the sign-up process as expected. The user remains on the same registration step.
